Title: Secure Grip
Description: The nail holder must firmly secure nails of various sizes and lengths, preventing slipping or shifting during hammering.

Title: Durability
Description: The nail holder should be robust enough to withstand repeated hammer impacts without deforming or breaking.

Title: Safety
Description: The nail holder must protect the user's fingers and hands from accidental hammer strikes and potential injuries.

Title: Ease of Use
Description: The nail holder should allow quick and effortless insertion and removal of nails, even when the user is wearing gloves.

Title: Compatibility
Description: The nail holder must accommodate a wide range of nail sizes and types commonly used in carpentry and construction tasks.

Title: Visibility
Description: The nail holder should provide clear visibility of the nail head and the target area, enabling precise and accurate hammering.

Title: Ergonomic Design
Description: The nail holder must be ergonomically designed for comfortable handling, reducing hand fatigue during extended use.

Title: Material Quality
Description: The nail holder should be made from durable, corrosion-resistant materials suitable for both indoor and outdoor applications.

Title: Compact and Lightweight
Description: The nail holder must be compact, lightweight, and portable, allowing for easy storage and convenient carrying in tool belts or toolboxes.

Title: Cost-Effective
Description: The nail holder should offer a good balance between affordability, quality, durability, and functionality, providing value for money to the user.

Title: Sharp Edges
Description: The nail holder should not have sharp edges or corners that could injure the user or damage surfaces.

Title: Slippery Surface
Description: The nail holder should not have a slippery or smooth surface that reduces grip and control during use.

Title: Fragile Components
Description: The nail holder should not contain fragile or easily breakable components that fail under normal hammering conditions.

Title: Excessive Weight
Description: The nail holder should not be excessively heavy, as this would cause user fatigue and reduce maneuverability.

Title: Complicated Mechanisms
Description: The nail holder should not have overly complicated or intricate mechanisms that make it difficult to use or maintain.

Title: Limited Nail Compatibility
Description: The nail holder should not be restricted to only one specific nail size or type, limiting its versatility and usefulness.

Title: Poor Visibility
Description: The nail holder should not obstruct the user's view of the nail head or target area, as this would reduce accuracy and precision.

Title: Corrosion-Prone Materials
Description: The nail holder should not be made from materials prone to rust or corrosion, which would shorten its lifespan and reliability.

Title: Loose or Unstable Parts
Description: The nail holder should not have loose or unstable parts that could detach or shift during hammering, posing safety hazards.

Title: High Cost Without Added Value
Description: The nail holder should not be overly expensive without providing additional functionality, durability, or quality benefits to justify the higher price.
